Package Server

Class ProtocolMessages

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server.ProtocolMessages
  • public abstract class ProtocolMessages
extends java.lang.Object
    The messages class used for protocol group
    Author:
    Floris Henein

    • Method Detail

      • containsIllegalCharacter

        public static boolean containsIllegalCharacter​(java.lang.String text)
        Check if a string contains an illegal character.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to check for errors
        Returns:
        true if text contains an illegal character, false otherwise

      • getKeyWord

        public static java.lang.String getKeyWord​(java.lang.String message)
        Return the keyword of a message.
        Parameters:
        message - is the message that contains a keyword
        Returns:
        the keyword

      • roomDataToString

        public static java.lang.String roomDataToString​(java.lang.String roomName,
                                                int amountOfPlayers,
                                                int capacity,
                                                boolean hasPassword)
        Return data of a room in the right format to put it in a list.
        Parameters:
        roomName - is the name of the room
        amountOfPlayers - is the amount of players that currently are in the room
        capacity - is the maximum amount of players in that room
        hasPassword - is the boolean value that tells if the room has a password
        Returns:
        a string version of a room, e.g. "room1,2,3,true" or "room2,4,4,false"

      • roomsListToString

        public static java.lang.String roomsListToString​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> rooms)
        Returns a string that contains a list of string representations of rooms.
        Parameters:
        rooms - is a list of rooms in string format
        Returns:
        a string version of a list of rooms, e.g. "room1,2,3,true:room2,4,4,false: ... :room69,1,2,true"

      • fieldListToString

        public static java.lang.String fieldListToString​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> fields)
        Returns a string that contains a list of colors in a field. E.g. B,B,B,W,E,E,E,b,E,b,b,b,b,R,R,R ... , R,B
        Parameters:
        fields - is an arraylist of color strings. Use the string in this class for the correct color
        Returns:
        a string that can be built with for sending the board data through a socket

      • requestConnectToServer

        public static java.lang.String requestConnectToServer​(java.lang.String username)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for sending a connectionRequest to the server.
        Parameters:
        username - Username to use for authentication
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket, E.g. "c:TheLegend27"

      • requestDisconnectFromServer

        public static java.lang.String requestDisconnectFromServer()
        Builds a string according to the protocol for sending a disconnectRequest to the server.
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket, e.g. "d"

      • requestCreateRoom

        public static java.lang.String requestCreateRoom​(java.lang.String gameName,
                                                 java.lang.String password,
                                                 int capacity)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for sending a createGame request to the server. E.g. "create:room1:qwerty:4" or "create:room1::4"
        Parameters:
        gameName - is the name of the room
        password - is the password for joining the room. Leave empty String for no password
        capacity - is the maximum amount of players for that room
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • requestJoinRoom

        public static java.lang.String requestJoinRoom​(java.lang.String gameName,
                                               java.lang.String password)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for sending a joinRoom request to the server. E.g. "join:room1:qwerty" or "join:room1:"
        Parameters:
        gameName - is the name of the room you want to join
        password - is the password of the room. Give empty string if there is no password
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • requestListRooms

        public static java.lang.String requestListRooms()
        Builds a string according to the protocol for sending a roomList request to the server. E.g. "list"
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • requestReady

        public static java.lang.String requestReady()
        Builds a string according to the protocol for sending a ready message to the server. E.g. "ready"
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • requestMove

        public static java.lang.String requestMove​(int pos1,
                                           int pos2,
                                           int pos3,
                                           java.lang.String direction)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for making a move. E.g. "move:3:4:5:L" or "move:3:::UR"
        Parameters:
        pos1 - is the position of the first marble. Leave pos empty if no marble is moved
        pos2 - is the position of the second marble
        pos3 - is the position of the third marble
        direction - is the direction the marbles should move. Use a direction constant from this class
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • requestPlayerData

        public static java.lang.String requestPlayerData()
        Builds a string according to the protocol for requesting data of players in a room. E.g. "getplayers"
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • requestQuitRoom

        public static java.lang.String requestQuitRoom()
        Builds a string according to the protocol for leaving your current room. E.g. "quit"
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • requestChat

        public static java.lang.String requestChat​(java.lang.String message)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for sending a chat message. E.g. "say:Knock knock"
        Parameters:
        message - Message to send
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • startGame

        public static java.lang.String startGame()
        Builds a string according to the protocol for notifying clients the game starts. E.g. "start"
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • giveTurn

        public static java.lang.String giveTurn​(java.lang.String username)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for giving the turn to a player. E.g. "turn:TheLegend27"
        Parameters:
        username - is the user to which the turn is handed
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • updateMove

        public static java.lang.String updateMove​(java.lang.String username,
                                          int pos1,
                                          int pos2,
                                          int pos3,
                                          java.lang.String direction)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for updating a move to all players. E.g. "update:TheLegend27:2:3:4:L" or "update:TheLegend27:4:::UL"
        Parameters:
        username - is the name of the user that made the move
        pos1 - is the position of the first marble. Enter -1 for no position
        pos2 - is the position of the second marble. Enter -1 for no position
        pos3 - is the position of the third marble. Enter -1 for no position
        direction - is the direction of the move
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • gameOver

        public static java.lang.String gameOver​(java.lang.String username)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for informing the player that the game stopped. E.g. "gover:TheLegend27" or "gover:"
        Parameters:
        username - is the name of the user that won. Leave empty if it is a draw
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • sayAll

        public static java.lang.String sayAll​(java.lang.String username,
                                      java.lang.String message)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for broadcasting a chat message to all players in a room. E.g. "sayall:TheLegend27:GG ez, git gud u n00bs"
        Parameters:
        username - is the name of the user that sent the message
        message - is the message that has been sent
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • giveRooms

        public static java.lang.String giveRooms​(java.lang.String rooms)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for giving a list of all current rooms. E.g. "rooms:room1,2,4,true:room2,3,3,false: ... :room69,1,2,true"
        Parameters:
        rooms - is the list of rooms and their data
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • ok

        public static java.lang.String ok()
        Builds a string according to the protocol for responding with an ok to the client. E.g. "ok"
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • error

        public static java.lang.String error​(java.lang.String error)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for responding with a fail message to the client. E.g. "fail:unknown_format"
        Parameters:
        error - is the error that happened
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • askBoard

        public static java.lang.String askBoard()
        Builds a string according to the protocol for asking the board of the client or server. E.g. "askboard"
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket

      • giveBoard

        public static java.lang.String giveBoard​(java.lang.String boardData)
        Builds a string according to the protocol for giving the board data to the server or client. E.g. "giveboard:R,R,B,b,W,E,E,E, ... ,W,W"
        Parameters:
        boardData - is the data of the board. Use
        Returns:
        a string in the correct format that can be sent through the socket
